conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D, E, or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid A (orange) flows downward from the top left.
Liquid A encounters a green baffle that diverts it downwards.
Liquid A hits a turquoise baffle, which guides it further down.
Liquid A is directed towards container D (blue).
Liquid B (blue) flows downward from the top center.
Liquid B hits a purple baffle that directs it towards the green baffle.
The green baffle diverts Liquid B towards the right.
Liquid B passes over the white container and into container E (white).
Liquid C (light blue) flows downward from the top right.
Liquid C encounters a brown baffle that directs it straight down.
Liquid C flows into container F (black).
Liquid A flows into container D.
Liquid B flows into container E.
Liquid C flows into container F.
Final answer: A flows into D, B flows into E, and C flows into F.
